intro: Phoradendron neurophyllum, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This species plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
